readme_documentation_comments: The README file provides a good overview of the project, including its concept, problem statement, and solution. It also includes links to demo videos and code structure information. However, there are some areas where the documentation could be improved.

readme_documentation_comments: The README file provides a good overview of the oDoc project, including its purpose, features, and technology stack. It also includes setup instructions for local development, which is excellent. The file is well-structured and easy to follow.

Existing features were also modified or improved, such as the agreement view component and contract table component. Additionally, files were added, deleted, or renamed, and overall, the changes aimed to improve the application's user experience, functionality, and stability.; Week of 2025-08-08: This week, the development team improved the AI chat component with a refactored UI and onboarding process, added a progressive tutorial for promise creation, and enhanced the job matching algorithm and UI. Additionally, the team updated the landing page content, added a job tutorial component, and made various improvements to existing features, including typing animation, markdown rendering, and user data handling. They also refactored code to optimize performance, improve code formatting, and remove unused components and files. Additionally, they added new test cases and updated dependencies to ensure better testing and deployment.

readme_documentation_comments: The README file provides only a single setup instruction for local development, which is a good start. However, it lacks a general project description, integration instructions, and contribution guidelines, which are essential elements of comprehensive documentation. The file is also very brief and lacks clarity and structure. The formatting is also not consistent, with only a single line of code provided in a code block. Overall, the documentation is limited and requires significant improvement to be considered good quality.

No new features were added, but the existing codebase was refactored to work with the new build setup. The overall impact is a modernized project structure and a potentially improved development workflow.; Week of 2025-08-15: This week, the project underwent significant changes, including the migration to React Vite and revamping the user interface design. The most notable additions were the creation of a new file structure and the introduction of new components and layouts. The overall impact is a modernized and improved user experience.

readme_documentation_comments: The documentation is decent, but it lacks some important elements. The project description is brief and only provides a high-level overview of the ICP Package Manager. There is no clear setup instruction for local development, which is crucial for developers who want to contribute to the project. The integration guide is also missing, which makes it difficult for users to understand how to install and use the package manager. The contribution guidelines are provided in a separate file (`TODO.md`), which is not easily accessible from the README file.
commit_activity_comments: 1 - 1 or 2 commits. Weekly development summary: Week of 2025-08-01: This week, the development team focused on improving the wallet backend and frontend canister, adding a copy button to the principal display, and fixing various bugs and code comments. The team also refactored settings defaults, simplified limit retrieval, and consolidated SHA-256 implementations. Additionally, they made changes to the bootstrapper data canister, agent dependency, and user cycle balance management.

readme_documentation_comments: The README file provides a good overview of the project, including its features, technical architecture, and user story. The project description is clear, and the technical architecture section provides a good breakdown of the frontend and backend components. However, I would have liked to see more detailed setup instructions for local development, as well as integration instructions for integrating the project with other systems. The contribution guidelines are also lacking, which could make it difficult for new contributors to get started.
